WupOLBzEiU_WyHe1Yr_wAw.text: The V Beauregard Blueberry Sour Ale from College Street Brewery is the BEST beer I have ever tasted. The truffle fries were amazing, and so was my pork sandwich. 10/10 recommend.

KMAHVNF2WCdmDyQkKbJ47Q.text: Awesome place - great food, great service, very cool vibe inside. It's kind of small but it's very cool. They have smoked meats and burgers and a good selection of local beers which is the perfect idea for a restaurant if you ask me. The portions are good size. The poutine fries for $6 was huge. Definitely will be back here when I'm in town again!

P4Ux9NGixuLQlpWa_CQbdw.text: BBQ...and especially the ribs were just so so.  Beers were definitely good to balance it out.  Atmosphere was above average, but if going for food.  They need some help here.

LYF7sYpPIgwmWtVf58sDCA.text: This place is legit. Went there for lunch today and the brisket sandwich is delicious. Good brews and undeniably some of the best customer service I've seen.

fn_ftD0GTiuhRCsdHq9KEA.text: Wow.....what a great secret spot! If you're looking for great BBQ and scrumptious hamburgers with wonderful service, you've now found it!

CaUr2xcegCfua41EVay-0g.text: Epic fail.  Replaced three kegs while we were there.  Flavor profiles of beer were very strange and overloaded with grapefruity IPAs.  Burgers were most underwhelming we have ever had.  Coleslaw was okay, potato salad about what you would expect out of a plastic container from the grocery store.  I would avoid this place.

UTqb5S3gWwLp_jbsSfCSSA.text: Adorable! These guys are awesome and they make GREAT food! It's a bit of a limited menu but EVERYTHING was great. We were a party of 18, played softball all day and we're hungry and a bit rambunctious. Our waiter was terrific and dealt with lots of women talking at the same time. Melt the n your mouth ribs, two thumbs up on the twisted cactus burger, margaritas flowed. Moscow mules very very good. Come here you won't regret it! Fresh veggies were very fresh. Ribs outrageous.

zmH8SXPZWTkSU8J2YvdrMw.text: This place was pretty good. The quality of the food was great. They say it's a half pound burger, not sure about that. The service was a slow. They were also out of a couple of menu items. My husband had their IPA he said it was great he had two.  The prices were reasonable for what you got. This is a father /son establishment, it's small. They did hire a waitress. If you want a good burger and beer, this is a good place to try.

y8o7GR5-TXnfBNjKroUUiQ.text: Amazing service. I don't think my glass of tea ever was empty. Had the pork sandwhich and side salad. The salad was big enough to be the entree. Terrific homemade dressing. Husbands Cuban was tasty and filling as well.  Will stop again when not planning on traveling just to sample all the beer.

HZY_wyrGwUe7c87ELNVZ7g.text: Decent burgers and beer.  Small little place and portions were good sized.Very reasonable price for the burger.  The place was quite empty for 5:30 p.m.

W6CRN8hjy8YTAEazebd9cg.text: Thanks, to my fellow Yelpers; I was able to have one of the best Burger for my lunch. I mixed the Cow Boy and Big Chandler Burger together. Man, I almost ate my fingers and, I bit my tongue. I'm shocked this spot isn't crowded. My new go to for a real big juicy, flavorful, taste like, home cooked backyard grill'n Burger spot. Will I share like the Care Bear's? Absalutily ;)

CPHszutrCaDYoHC6o4bj7g.text: Best BBQ ever! My husband and best friend and I were in town for a wedding. We stopped for lunch at Twisted Cactus. We all agreed - hands down the best BBQ any of us had aver had! Well done - highly recommended!

gi1rV_4B8HoV0uPFtde8YQ.text: We had a really great lunch! We had a burger and poutine and a salad. Everything was very tasty food wise. The bloody Mary needed some doctoring (hot sauce, pepper, salt did the trick)...but the staff was really lovely Abe the food was awesome!

q-lXiSqYJkM91xtW6Va7sw.text: Great little place, the staff was amazingly friendly, and the food was great!  They did not carry their own beer, but had a good selection of locals

rW6WY5Cu-NkQCuRyUXIH4A.text: They don't brew their own beer quite yet as they just got new owners, but the food is phenomenal. I travel 4 days a week and this is one of the best burgers I've had in a long time (the bbq is no slouch, either). All beer on tap is local.

qz6lbAJtKi9AhHO7OG9kEw.text: We've been here several times recently and have enjoyed the food, drinks, people, and neighborhood atmosphere. However, this last time was a poor experience. The Moscow mules tasted like pure soda water and service was all around poor. Giving 2 stars weighted for previous visits and good food but would give this last visit 1 star. With so many quality options in town, I will look elsewhere before returning.

koq2GUg_WkTJf2DhpZAHqA.text: To bad I can't give a half  I would give the TCB company a 3.5. Great burgers 8, price 6.5, and I should not have had the Cuban. Good atmosphere fun little place worth a trip. Great local beers.

qPptQvFtfE61xOmcN3igew.text: Fresh food and hand cut fries! Excellent service! Found this place based on a yelp review, would definitely recommend to give it a try!

AtZ6u5SsM0R03LQWjbGyBA.text: Absolutely love this place! The food is delicious and they are family owned and operated. We had the meatless burrito, veggie tacos, and burgers. All we perfectly cooked and the drinks were great too. The service is awesome as well, attentive, caring and just fun! Thanks for a great lunch spot!

DlsD_H-8mqn-P6eGz0V4Og.text: I've been here 4-5 times. Burgers bbq and sides are all high quality. Cowboy burger is my favorite. One reason I keep coming back is they can consistently cook. Med rare burger. Friendly staff, great music and comfy atmosphere. If you want something a little different I'd suggest to check it out.

5n-nqElIaMEfOCuts2LI-A.text: Delicious! Great beer, go and check this place out!!! Great service too! The burger I had was cooked perfectly

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mmm, delicious fries. This is the Twisted cactus Burger. Green Chile&#39;s and chipotle aioli. Very good! And cooked perfectly. Check it out!!

nTBZKicTRlun3PdDGCjK1Q.text: Great little BBQ place.  The ribs are tasty and meaty! The garlic fries are a must! I would recommend if you are a BBQ fan!

PiLiV_etfa70-f0ouy9qIA.text: Dropped in to check it out while on this side of town and we were not disappointed.  Nice AZ brews and in house BBQ. Pulled pork, brisket and great ribs. The St. Louis style ribs best I've had in a long time.   Sides I included hand cut fries and potato salad. Both fantastic ask for the fries crispy.   Overall we really enjoyed this place. Definitely recommend checking it out.

43mEEV5Fng4jJOaY8_7_EQ.text: Drive be a couple times and finally decided to stop in and I was very glad I did!! Great food, great beer, and great service. The menu offers more than just BBQ and the little cozy environment really makes you feel like you're at home. I will definitely be coming back and telling all my friends.

UColWyYJwpDiX8we4lpGZw.text: Don't judge a book by it's cover. Looking at the store front you can't guess the delights that await you when you walk through the door. The food is very good, reasonably priced.  Especially the lunch menu. They have a decent selection of draft beer, although a lot of IPAs. More diversity would be appreciated but I have zero complaints. I had a wonderful lunch and the service was great.  If you've been waiting to give this place a try, do yourself a favor and end the wait. You won't be sorry.

uSorWDp2TJ8V1XZpoEy2kw.text: First time here tonight for dinner. They were out of the sausage, first sign that it's quality BBQ. No worries, the ribs had a great smoke ring and the sauce is a great pair for the smoke flavor. If you don't like strong smoke flavor, you many want to try the brisket or pulled pork.  I also tried the pulled pork and chopped brisket sliders to get a taste of as much of their bbq as possible. Neither one disappointed, they had enough meat that each one with overflowing and we added the leftover meat to our fries.  Fries were great. Fresh hand cut fries. Hot from the fryer and salted well.   BBQ beans were below average. Little flavor. I won't order them again.  Our server was amazing! Very attentive, but not a stalker.

xSNrjMP27mlda5poP_I7xg.text: Came on a work day lunch looking for a new burger place. I had the regular burger with fries, it was extremely good. Unfortunately it would have been better with a beer, they have a wide selection of local brewery beers. Place decor was inviting, friendly service. I definitely will be back when not working.

1undcU4C4EDgdWP0wv-PFg.text: So, I'm checking yelp for a dinner option and the stars brought me in. I got there and had no idea what to expect. Small place seats about 50... Food smells good and the place is empty so we can sit anywhere. There's a young guy there manning the front and one guy in the kitchen. I'm still unsure...  The host (Alex)who seated us was sooooo cool! The music let me know I was home. I won't elaborate. You'll have to go and see for yourself. The menu is just big enough to give a variety for a small place with a small crew. I ordered the Cactus burger. My guests ordered the Cowboy. Typical order for a first visit to a new restaurant. Safe option til you get familiar with the new spot  and all it's inner workings. I'm obsessed with fresh unadulterated French fries (like my mother made when I was growing up). They have just that. Potatoes and sea salt. Why mess them up with anything else!  Meanwhile, Alex is being the host with the most! Making sure we are enjoying the music, offering suggestions for dinner..: we can see the cook in the back, making it happen. AND, Brioche on a burger say no more! Perfectly cooked well done without burning the flavor out of the meat.  To finish the meal, we had the fried ice cream... fabulous!!! Thanks Alex and nice guy in the kitchen! We will return soon to try the bbq!

VcuqXMlvnY6JsGp5_SlnXA.text: Love this spot. Local beers and delicious bbq are excellent. Really enjoyed our lunch. I had chopped bbq pork sandwich while my wife had the bacon bleu burger. Fries are hand cut and delicious.   Want processed food and a Bud, if so, don't go here.

aPJ5sU0ymVjyhv8PbkxSdA.text: Absolutely love this place! We've been coming here regularly for the last couple of years and it never disappoints. Their ribs, tacos, burgers and brisket are fantastic. The service is always great and very friendly and they have an excellent rotating selection of featured arizona craft brews.

BxpA-YqJlyE_xXP13tqjkg.text: This place was amazing don't let the little store front ward you off. Home made burger patties the flavor was amazing!!!! I had the Grand Canyon burger the brisket was Smokey and soft. It was a great place to eat.

vWYO2wTsVP0Y8W1McHGkIg.text: Small BBQ Place with great Brisket Sandwich.  Great service and good food.  The portions could have been larger...the sandwiches were a bit small for the price, but all-in-all a good experience and I'd go back.

Oz5-kysKFTfSN4iAs4nvWA.text: Love this hole in the wall, blip on the strip, eatery of meatery for mouth wateringly fresh BBQ. Super tender & flavorful pulled pork that is great on the Poutine Fries or a sandwich. The brisket is tender & nicely complimented by the in house barbecue sauce which is thick, tangy, and a little spicy. Beverages include local brewery beers that change with the season. The decor is Arizona desert playful and the service is friendly & prompt. A great place for a casual meal with friends or a date night.

Qr9WeSi3dCmjYmO8uxqlmA.text: We were looking for something local and different. If u lov craft beers, they have some different kinds but food was average and a bit pricy for what u get.

wJIcfARiH2e0wHB4VPtCag.text: How is this place not way busier? Great food, great music, great alcohol, and reasonable prices. We had the poutine and quesadillas both cost $6. If I lived closer I would come here all the time. Highly recommend!

9BbucDEWwAEY-IFHY0fg_Q.text: Good food and a few microbrews to try. Nice atmosphere, with an open kitchen. Excellent service.

ju3OawzpAAAAy02U_lhcjA.text: Found this place for a quick late afternoon lunch. Great tasting ribs and good beer selection. Fantastic and friendly service

2iKPeFYtkTyKqIEVEIXRtA.text: 3.5 stars from me - great burger, cooked to a nice medium rare, really enjoyed it. Would have been a nice value but the potato salad that came with it was kind of a tiny portion, served in a little cup. If it were a bit bigger I'd come back for more burgers, or maybe just order fries next time. Service was a bit mixed - great from one person and kind of cold from another, not sure if one or both were the owners. Seems like a good local place with good food and drinks, but not feeling a need to hurry back.

fpQuH7uzAH8eNESAh-0haw.text: First of all ..... this place is not a Brewery, they sell other Breweries products and there is not much of a selection.  Food is ok but they always seem to see how fast they can serve you like it's an accomplishment.  When you order food and they serve it 3-4 minutes later, it's like it was already made, all the did was take it out of a warmer and put it on a plate.  Also .......  I guarantee if the sold Coors Light and Jack Daniels more people would be there and stay longer.  Everyone knows BBQ and Whiskey go hand and hand.  .  Have you change owners again?

rWfLKWUpbVcZZCLZdAV-lg.text: Had the pork quesadillas. Perfect size/portion. Lot of great flavor and fresh. Definitely recommend this dive   staff was genuinely friendly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States

I_ofjo-58kxJ7pVJEMBGOQ.text: The food was so yummy!  My husband got the Cowboy Up burger and loved it. I got the Black and Blue and was so impressed. Even our picky eater thought the chicken was "so good". They have board games to entertain and spend some family time while waiting. Highly recommend!

-7y9WDe1PzX0v-ucP688eg.text: My boyfriend stumbled upon this brewery for some dinner and it was excellent! Service was great! Server was very attentive and kind. The food was really awesome. I got the Cuban sandwich (which I recommend with one of their specialty sauces, yummy) and he got the pulled pork sandwich also really tasty. May need some more local breweries on tap but their ice is the bee's knees. Def recommend.

h6kRSkrsKmAtj2qtngElQg.text: I appreciated the presentation, quality and value of their offering. We get so use to eating food that's been stripped of everything and masked in sauce that it's just simply great that a burger like this exists. This is what a burger is supposed to be from top to bottom. Simple, tasty, quality that resonates to the toasted bun from their panini maker. They have it to create a Cuban which I'll try on my next visit. Overall I'm just appreciative that a good burger does exist out there if your not taking a good burger for granted.  Beer needs to be colder. Arizona summer dictates it. That burger with a colder beer, perfection.

NhD7X1b7RE4iDcooljht4g.text: Great burgers, great local brews! Although the menu is limited, what they serve up is really tasty!

EOlm62QS-yErnMvxpLRUiA.text: Great little local beer place, great food options and friendly staff.  Support your local small business and check em' out! We'll be back for sure

UIScLGcSf66451we1juKog.text: I have been here several times now at different times and days since they opened in November. The service is always fantastic, and the food is superb. Their current mussel special is DIVINE.  I will continue to frequent this place for the hospitality, service, and food. Once they start brewing their own, it will only give me a FOURTH reason to keep returning.

tzT8AnldTiv3ELHeTKZHuw.text: Welcome to the neighborhood! Burgers are very good! All food was good actually and prices were modest. We will be back.

aOBqknYVQpk8kP6SNRDgSw.text: We've been here a couple times, most recently for my wife's birthday. Great BBQ. What the beer list lacks in length it makes up for with quality. We always have had friendly service. Good atmosphere. Enjoyed the live music. Highly recommended.

QY4aHArq8sy4lDs6kDo5OQ.text: How is it that more people do not know about this gem of a place? We've been going there for over 2 years (since shortly after they opened) and always enjoy a fun time with tasty local beers and exceptional food. They installed a smoker maybe a little over a year ago, and we especially like their smoked pork and their burgers. Lately, they've been hosting tap takeover nights with local breweries, and last night they had a very talented guitarist providing music. It's quiet in there compared to a lot of other places nearby, but it usually has a nice hum of conversation and activity going on. Their service is very attentive, professional, and welcoming.

DimohIHo53-Nw_hyweerAQ.text: The best BBQ place in Arizona! Food was amazing and service was great! Plus, they have an awesome selection of local alcohol you can't find anywhere. Ambiance with the huge TVs were a great touch. I will definitely recommend this spot to all my friends and coworkers.

Z0fng8WwQj7xzh2_L4wRjw.text: Great local place. We all got burgers because that is what we were craving. I think maybe I'll try the BBQ next time. My burger was a little lacking, too much bun and not enough "stuff" on it. Willing to give it another do!

QEB81fn9_9IJ-8QPzSLhZg.text: Here for a 14U baseball tournament.  Awesome service, craft beer and Grand Canyon Burger were even better.

uck4DUllgMOkWeLsLr1Nhw.text: The Cactus Burger w/poutine fries was delicious! This was our first time here, and had excellent service with great food and beer!

EKaGXh_ZDT741nP62XgDgg.text: We didn't get a chance to eat the food unfortunately. However my husband and I sat there and waited for service. Three customers walked in about 15 minutes after us and were helped right away. At that point I took my money else where. I just hate being treated that way. I'm sorry but your bartender may need better service training or you need to hire more staff for a busy Friday night.

t6MNhsdv8kGATm0wEj0ZVg.text: What a gem! The Ribs are official: hot, tender, and reasonably priced. Bomb! The beans, fries, and taquitos even exceed all expectations. And the BBQ SAUCE - which can make or break any bbq joint -- the SAUCE is 100% legit. Balanced with sweet & hot. (I typically avoid the bbq sauces but this one is one you'll want to bottle up.) And then there are the LOCAL drink selections: locally brewed beer & locally brewed spirits. (Even local wines - that are just outstanding.) Lastly, the service is remarkable and down-right uplifting: Kyle provided a unique, engaged, & thoughtful dining experience. Twisted will not disappoint. We will be back! If not for the ribs...for the local drinks and happy camaraderie.

bxkSdbWEkTucxgL6b9rIOg.text: Great food and fun time.    Taco Tuesday was a great way to try the bbq.   Drinks were awesome loved the strawberry cider (no sugar added) and the hemp ipa.     The service and family attention made our visit memorable.   We will be back .

6GfKvdENiGQsUxgcfRinmw.text: The food we have ordered was absolutely delicious. The portions were decent sized. We've ordered poutine fries, burger and a burrito. The food arrived in a timely manner.   The service was outstanding. The gentleman (owner?) serving us was the only person on staff besides the cook and he handled all tables like a champ. This is a nice local joint and we will definitely be back.

Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Poutine fries

ushIj3aRdjZhnzwiTahliw.text: You know you're in for a great experience when you walk in the door and are greeted immediately by staff. The cozy space has comfortable seating and a fully stocked bar. The food is delicious, especially the pork tacos and beef burritos served on Taco Tuesdays. An excellent selection of craft beers -- including Arizona ones -- ensures there is always one you will enjoy. For us, Twisted Cactus is a perfect addition to our go to list.

caGCxsMgSd39HR32MKo4gw.text: Great food, great service and best time in Chandler. Try this place and you'll love it

lHB1eliedbS8qlVzyy8F1w.text: We visited for the first time a couple of weeks ago and were very pleased. Super friendly and cozy. Good menu with vegetarian options and lots of beer choices. We went on a Saturday and they had  live music...guitar...not too loud...Colin I believe, and he was just fantastic.

QkaCtV30yRZ0a4YBSsnlBw.text: Food was excellent. Tons of flavor. The beer selection was great and waitress had a good knowledge of menu. I had the smoked brisket soup and it was amazing!!! My son got the kids grilled cheese with potatoes salad. The potatoes salad had so much flavor with a nice mustard accent. The truffle fries are awesome. My husband got the twisted cactus burger which was good too.

-qQ55amzFcZicpM-ugBHNA.text: Oh my, the smoked brisket is amazing!!!!  Got it on a brioche bun,  with delicious bbq sauce.  So good!!!!  The fries are hands made and delicious.   Would love to come back!

ihq1xXrRxhylLJVn6GAq1Q.text: I like places like this that are kind of out of the way and really unassuming. Just a small little bar but I had a great time.   I got a burger and it was cooked perfectly, the fries were on point and the guy who served us was super cool and helpful. It was my first time in and I had some questions that he answered without hesitation.   One of the nice things about this place as well is that it's menu is not massive which makes things easy in choosing.   Go here, eat food, be happy.

B5bmqOT1k55yoXSEcoivIw.text: Twisted Cactus is one of my favorite restaurants in the area. Great food, great beer, great atmosphere, great service. I really appreciate how this brewery sticks to local beers and wines. Delicious brisket and Mexican food and the poutine fries are a must! They recently underwent a change in ownership and have expanded the menu giving costumers even more great lunch and dinner options.

Jy5mi_VTm9oBTxDVUQA2bQ.text: I've eaten here twice now and both times the food was excellent.  The brisket is tender and the BBQ sauce is delicious.  This past Friday a neighboring table had an interesting looking item.  We asked the waitress about it and she said the chef smoked brats that day, but they weren't on the menu.  She's brought us  one to try and it was delicious.  Staff is friendly and background music was relaxing.

QX1D1getgVaIOv_uQu6oiA.text: I love to try new places - especially breweries. I was excited to try this place, as it was just down the road from my house. I went during lunch on a weekday, so not too much traffic. They have not yet started brewing their own beer, but that should be happening in the next couple of weeks. I will definitely return to sample those.  As it is now, they have six taps of regional beer. Mostly Arizona, but they did have 2 varieties of Scuplin on tap. Although just a few handles, all of the beers are good options. I had a coffee brown from the Shop (another one of my favorite places) and a Dragoon IPA. The food not only was good, but for a brewery the presentation was excellent. I ordered the Cuban sandwich, and the marinated pork was excellent. I paired it with a salad instead of fries. The portions were large and the presentation was impressive. I would go back just on the food alone.  The space has a nice feel as well. I love the exposed brick look. This will be a great spot to hang out and have a few new local beers and good food. Definitely give them a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dragoon IPA
Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cuban sandwich
Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Right now a menu of visiting beers. They should have their own beer in a couple of weeks.

I_pQo2EUgIHAKjvvq7uhLw.text: Cute little local place with good beers and food.  The night we were there, they had live music.  It was nice since the guy playing guitar had a good voice and good variety of songs, but it wasn't so loud that we couldn't talk.  We'll be back.

jjpTg5GrXIGgTbJg6vIWmw.text: The food was fabulous, which was a surprise because the restaurant decor and furniture was tired and wobbly. Poor signage so never would have known it was there if hadn't seen a posting on a local group. But the food.... so good!!! Husband had the brisket sandwich and I had the twisted cactus burger. It didn't look like there was enough sauce on my burger but every bite was packed with flavor. Really great!

tybLqq9RBwP3tyS2C9Ljtg.text: I do believe this place is going to be one of our new regular haunts. Excellent food, service, friendliness, atmosphere, and drinks.  We'll be back for Taco Tuesday!

qgfk5mnX_zWvGkAKGE0CCw.text: This is a great place!  Service and even some of the other patrons were very friendly. Nice atmosphere, plenty of local brews and wines to choose from. Food was reasonably priced and delicious. Great burgers and tacos. We will definitely come here again!

XuEAaCjkUG_Li6mdJ_ZcWg.text: We came here for a late dinner on a Wednesday. There weren't many people here but it wasn't empty. We were told to sit anywhere and we got our menus right away.   Drinks- we don't drink beer, so maybe that was our mistake. They didn't have iced tea. The soda is in cans. I got Diet Coke. The ice that I poured my Diet Coke into tasted horrible. Made the whole drink taste bad.   Food- we got the poutine as an appetizer and it was good. I'd recommend  it. It did take awhile to come to our table though. We also ordered burgers and fries. They were delicious- hence more stars. Cooked well and tasted great. One complaint- we wanted to try the trio of sauces but the server (who is also apparently the owner) said they were out of all of the sauces. Bummer.   Service- ok. Not great. He was a little frazzled and seemed to not quite know what he was doing. It also took a very very long time for him to bring us our bill. In fact I wrote this review while we waited. We eventually had to get up and ask for it.   Overall- I think there are a lot of areas for improvement and it could be a lot better.

E5mDA-w04eaLsVGcXL_a8A.text: Great little local spot.  An array of local brews & really good food!  And we are foodies with a critical palette!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Empty glasses.....a good sign!

TncJoMVKVtjd4I-Effy2vg.text: Had high hopes to find a neighborhood watering hole. The bartender was very attentive. I found their house IPA pretty unremarkable. Same for the beer bites. It seems they have sort of an identity crisis in their decor. Like random pics and Hobby Lobby type bar/beer signs. There was a dude who seemed like the owner. He made a joke about people asking if they had Coors Light and upon learning they didn't carry it just went for water. We all sort of laughed but the irony was not lost on me that the biggest beer sign in the places was... you guessed it, Coors Light. I hope we got a bad batch of IPA and that otherwise people flock to this seemingly mom & pop place.

tkQeRRCI-9N2l13Y45RDRQ.text: We were the first customers through the door and have been back every week since opening unless we have been out of town. TC is a great small family owned business.  The food is great. Everything is reasonably priced and the owners are receptive to customer feedback. One simple example was folks asked them to add a chicken sandwich to the menu and they did. The weekly menu specials are a nice way to change things up. My favorite burger is the Twisted Cactus burger and it has always been cooked properly. I'm a medium well guy and get sick and tired of other places bringing me out a rare burger. Thank you TC for getting it right.   We look forward to more beers being produced by Twisted Cactus. In the meantime the alternative selections, especially from other AZ Brewers is great.   Everyone should give this place a try.

4_gE3lNHdHx8rAsy32NthA.text: Since the bar has changed ownership, there has been a complete 180. Bartenders are friendly and they are usually serving unfiltered IPA. The bbq is fantastic!

MM2jWcUWPssVq-m1UEC05Q.text: The barbecue was very good here and so was the service! Small place, great barbecue and good beer!

m5HBVV32crql7_jk_abqWg.text: Fantastic food & Great Service! Alec was awesome! We're in town from Texas and we know BBQ, eaten it all over. And this place is great. Got the two meat combo (Brisket & Pork) with BBQ Beans (fantastic). Mom got the Ribs, which were freaking fantastic as well. Finished it off with a fried ice cream!!  Good local beer selection, I got the Belgian Wheat, wife got the Cucumber Mule which had great flavor.   Will definitely be coming back next time we visit family!!!

DaE1mkfqeSDrNBkz7EMPjQ.text: Cozy neighborhood spot with excellent ribs, craft beer (Pumpkin Stout was a hit). Great place to meet friends, watch a game and share a great meal! We'll be back to try a burger, they look delicious!

H2sXa6ENxv9YiCjAQfWJvg.text: My Lovey and I went during our lunch break and we were pleasantly surprised.  The food was really good and the beer was quite tasty.  Tony was our server and I'm confident he was the owner. Very nice guy, pleasant and extremely patient.  We both had the Bomb Burrito.  I had the pork and Lovey had the brisket. We added a side of fries.  The burros were as good as any i've ever had. The fries are some of the best i've ever had.  We also enjoyed a nice cold glass of Kohi imperial coffee stout. Prices are very reasonable. We got out of there for $31 and I'm happy paying that to fill my belly and sample some great local beer.  Tony told us that he's preparing a happy hour menu and should have it all squared sometime next week.  We will def be back.   Prost!

smQtmu5QGsQqYc6X3A3iaQ.text: So, I really love the BBQ here. But at the rate they are going, they will be closed in a matter of months. They offer a pretty limited menu and they run out of food constantly! We have gone to the restaurant twice in 4 days and each time, they are out of food. How does that happen? It is only 6:00 in the evening. It's not like we came in at 10 PM. Very frustrating. I give them a 5 for food, a 1 for service (lack of good) so a 2 overall. I want this place to succeed but honesty I wont go out of my way again. If I'm in the area, I might stop in but I wont make it a destination. I would add the bartender working tonight (not one of the owners) was rude and could not have cared less about the situation.

Cdczr1Z09t6SlJvzlHo6qw.text: Came into town and wanted to check out this place due to the many positive reviews. We had a party of 12 and got seated in no time. Small place but we were in luck because it was fairly empty. The menu is simple and the descriptions help. We ordered our drinks and food and only waited 8-10 mins for the food to arrive. There is only one person in the kitchen making the orders so I was a little surprised at how quick our food arrived. Food is great! Everything was cooked fresh and the fries were delicious. My only complaint is when you order a soda, you get a can and no refills.

nDjmFTc1uq4CZKMEdxX6jw.text: Thought this place would be promising, had a small craft beer selection and who doesn't enjoy a good burger or tasty bbq. I was wrong...Server took forty five minutes to put our order in (the downside of an open kitchen- you see everything). After the point of sales kitchen ticket went in, he told us the kitchen was slow tonight. One guy busting his hump in the back cooking. Maybe our server wanted to give a breather? Either way, food took way too long and our service was glacially slow. There was maybe three other tables seated, so it wasn't busy by any standard. Bottom line, server messed up and threw the kitchen under the bus...Shame, wanted to like this place. The food was ok, nothing special.

l8Dk5oCw88tkhEZKe13N3g.text: One of my favorite places to eat while living in Phoenix. The staff are always so awesome and their service is fantastic. Never had to wait for drinks ever. The BBQ is unreal, go on taco Tuesday and get the rib taquitos! Omg, they sell out fast so go early. Great tap list of local stuff not always San Tan either :)

oqThI7wAmLAsi8Slp2b3pg.text: I love, love, love this place.  Killer family business and have the food and brews to back it up.  I normally order the burgers and they're a half-pound in addition cooked to order perfectly every time.  The fries are hand cut and are are to die for.  I've had the BBQ before, it's solid, but not the best I've ever had, so I'll stick to the burgers and beer.  The beer menu is always rotating, so there's no excuse to find something you will like.  Killer service too!

Wl-qHnrPOTA6tdb0z3mv3Q.text: The intersection of Ray and McClintock lacks a good bar.  Bongos tried.  Nosh tried.  Zipps was at the the NE corner for years.  Now they have moved.  This leaves a void.  A  monopoly for a  neighborhood bar and grill is available.  Twisted Cactus Brewing Company might have landed the punch.  They have been opened for months.  Tonight the bartender said some kegs didn't come in.    They only have 7 drafts on the menu.  Their own brew is far off.  Just focus on what you can provide and customers will come.  No need to apologize before each beer order.  This location is hidden.  I am hoping for the best.    My bartender was great.  Got me a beer and kept her attention on me.  No waiting, she knew I was reading the menu and got my pretzel order in.  Small size.  Fine for me, but not for more than 1.  Pic shown.  Good cheese sauce.  It was rather dead.  Sad for a Friday night.  I made my order and it was quick to arrive.  A,great presentation on the board.   This was the Cactus Brewery Burger with Swiss and green chillies.    Too many fries for me

T5b7ZtctstsNHfsO_4zoLQ.text: Great brisket. Fun, personable staff. A family-owned business.  Good crat brews. You have to give it a try.

UgmNTa_zzZtrtPSTZ-Hf0Q.text: Great bbq, casual atmosphere, local beers and friendly servers. Can't go wrong. They are looking to expand menu. Worth the visit.

8_82NY8XTB3yEdsu5kOFXA.text: Great local beer selections.  Pulled pork is a must have. And mellow live music. A really nice local bbq place. I'd be a regular if I lived here.

3K6m6koqm3_0T7D6_Gk35A.text: Very delicious barbecue spot  Had the 3 meat plate which was portioned appropriately and had soft meat. Also has all local drinks such as beer, wine and spirits. Will definitely return!

OizZTRJ90pnqqkYgvsYQPg.text: Their food is by far the best in the area. We came in with a group of 6 and they really took care of us. The place is very welcoming and they recently add a bar.  The owner came to our table and introduced himself to us and was very nice. We will definitely be back and bring more of our friends.

gnyzA_JdjYfSLkS6MnkFBA.text: Great food and atmosphere! We love going to local owned businesses! Beer selection is all local. Friendly staff!

bc7P7RFFk04NhrKSE-MUKA.text: Needed to find a place to have lunch with a few friends. Thanks to Yelp, I found this great spot. We all had different things from the menu and they were all delicious. Also there was a nice selection of beers to choose from. We will be back!

5Ow-dMm731G-xWCDVnqxTA.text: I've eaten here twice, both times with "out of town" guests.  Both times the food, service and drinks were fantastic.  Last night they had Live Music playing and it was awesome.  I live in East Mesa otherwise I would probably visit this place weekly.

JntdjoLjo8303ec2nfM19w.text: This small restaurant is amazing. I had a full rack of ribs as shown in my picture. The meat fell off of the bone and that sauce was amazing. My wife had a chicken sandwhich and fries and it was good. My son had the mexiburger it was excellent as well. Page the server was very helpful he suggested a few other places in town to get some variety. If you go make sure that you get dessert the orange cheesecake was amazing. Was a great experience and was so happy we chose it.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Full rack of ribs

YBAjemMBpK5eJvMHqlvIBA.text: Good place with good food. The place isn't very big so if you're with a big group you might mind it hard to find seating. We came on a Saturday evening and it was slow so we sat up at the bar. I ordered the brisket/pork taco combo and my husband had the brisket and bbq beans. Very good food! My tacos were authentic and had the right amount of spice. They don't have many beers on tap to choose from but the selection they had was good.  Service was friendly also. If you're looking for a smaller "hole in the wall" restaurant away from the busier restaurants I'd choose this place!

qWmPDJkVxHC0icRRKf4iQA.text: Great food, beer, prices, music, and service!   Super reasonable prices, really good beer selection, and a low key relaxed atmosphere. Definitely coming back!

_WEPGuC7tZaSgBiGrJDkTw.text: We all came here with our friends and family (party of 15) and hands down best service and great food In the area.  The bbq ribs, twisted cactus burgers and crispy burrito are all so delicious. We will definitely be back.

YBSKWeTv6f2PptsKf2GQyg.text: We ate dinner at the Twisted Cactus Brew last evening.  I will agree that the feeling is friendly.  The staff frequently checked by to see that we were doing okay.  They kept our drinks filled and took away our dirty plates.  The prices were reasonable.  The restaurant was clean and well staffed.  However, the food was less than stellar.  My husband ordered a burger.  It was not even close to what he was hoping for.  It looked like a burger I pan cooked on the top of our stove.  He was unimpressed.  I ordered the 2 meat BBQ dinner with a side of fries.  The fries were bland and a little greasy.  The meat was fatty and the bbq sauce was nondescript.  We also ordered queso and chips to start.  I wouldn't be surprised that there was a big can of yellow queso in the back.  The chips tasted like they came from a big bag.  It wasn't that the food was "bad" just nothing that would make me want to return.  There are better places to get BBQ with a wider selection of beer.  I wish my review could be better.  I like to frequent small businesses.

tnM8w_-oHODr0EVlXg1xXw.text: Wonderful brew and BBQ place, convenient to my work for Happy Hour, which offers great deals. Welcoming, convivial bar area - love the hand-cut fries and succulent smoked ribs!

dEsc2RiOd2yryu5wN2I32g.text: Yummy food, cold beers and friendly service! Great music and not too loud. Always a very solid meal.

Eog71iTXalePfYPGjmiVxw.text: 1st time in, amazing service, great decor and most of all the food was AMAZING!! will b back soon to try the rest of the menu!

nGL55Zt-EOrFgHV9KwqklA.text: We decided to try this place as it was in the shopping center we were already in. Food was OK. Not a huge menu to choose from but cool that they have beers. My sons grilled cheese sandwich was on a hamburger bun and the cheese wasn't even melted completely. The burgers were good- which I think was the best thing but besides that I wasn't impressed with the food.

rv4fmDXiNLVLEdj4D5VaVg.text: I think the primary photo of a burger served on a wooden plank is deceiving. That picture is what drew me in to try this place. I ordered that burger with potato salad. It was served in a green plastic basket, totally unlike the photo. The side of potato salad was a tiny scoop that you could eat in 2 bites. Which was sad to me because the potato salad tasted very good! it tasted far better than my burger.  Also, I'm confused by the name because I thought twisted cactus would have their own brews, which they did not. I enjoyed the beer I did have, which was an IPA. The TV picture quality is also kind of poor.   The owner was pretty nice though. He was inviting, and recommended we try the BBQ next time.

_5HmYo1dVuHlJIHcGaPvWA.text: Cenosillicaphobia is the fear of an empty glass. Make sure you keep a well-stocked fridge full of beer, y'all!  My real rating is closer to 3.5 stars. They recently got bought out like three weeks ago so they have to reapply for a new license in order to serve their own house brews so instead, they have other Arizona beers on tap. I feel like I can't rate them fairly yet since they don't have their house brews so let's just talk about everything else.   The food is pretty decent. They smoke their meats in house so that beautiful smoke meat ring can be found in your meat. I usually like my ribs saucy but I can appreciate that they don't want to mask the smokey flavor. The brisket sandwich was a bit dry though. I offered my coleslaw up to add moisture into the brisket sandwich. The house salad was basic as heck though so I'd probably skip that.   They have a small selection of Arizona beers on tap. All are served in a perfect cold mug. I can't wait to be able to try their own brews.  Service was a bit lacking since there were only like two people serving the whole restaurant but they're trying their best.  All in all, I would love to come back and try some Twisted Cactus beer but for now, I'm a bit sadden by the misleading business name.

OnxGN96__EiRqQ2ExvAL4A.text: I tried Twisted Cactus for the first time in June 2019.  I know that a good brisket it telling of of good BBQ and it was tender and tasty.  The beer choices were fun too so I tried the flight of 4 option.  The wife of the owners stopped by (who came in to help because how busy they got) and shared how they took over in the last few months.  Given their strong rating prior they have done well carrying on the reputation.  I commented how the restrooms were very clean, a nice surprise at a pub.  The icing on the cake was we got lucky with live music; very fun popular classic rock music at the perfect volume not overtaking dinner conversation.  We'll be back!

m33jEBaDPgEA8WQPougLaQ.text: I wanted to like this place. It's small and family-owned am be it's near my house. I was hoping it would end up a great little place to pop in.  I can't speak to the beer so maybe that's why it's getting the reviews?? The fries are horrible. They are legit soggy. I sent them back and asked for crispy ones. They came out as soggy as the first. It was clear they just don't know how to make decent fries which is a big problem my book. The burger wasn't awesome either. It was something I could have made on my grill at home and I'm no cook. Kinda greasy too.  Also the ranch dressing is not thick and milky, clearly not home made. It was just like the stuff I hate from a bottle at the grocery store. I wish I had tried out the brewery across the street instead.

sqISJb6n5DCVFl2A8wM-4A.text: I enjoyed the food, I ordered the brisket and it came out tender and juicy.

j0eTxQyHAmEV9ga3uE9-wQ.text: Great food, great beer, and great service! I tried their pulled pork sandwich and house IPA which were both awesome! The server was super cool and very attentive, the rest of the staff was wonderful, too! I'll definitely be back soon!

7yXrbDRhONPm0IMjCBe3gg.text: This place has great food, some of the best service I've ever had, and a great atmosphere!  Board games for the kids, the game on tv and awesome burgers and fries. Can't go wrong!

BwyN-adHeYZmUy2hISbbUw.text: So glad to see a good bar/restaurant back in this space. The local beer selection is fab! Can't wait to try their own brews when those are ready. Service is excellent and good is good (what we've tried so far). Yay.

XyurHSUdKppMVAkuDiWgDQ.text: First time visit but we'll definitely be back. Hubby had brisket sandwich and I highly recommend the Twisted Cactus burger. Owner was there waiting tables and making a point to talk to everyone. Great local hangout.

FYsEu9EzGN-kSzCJwSsbmw.text: We were excited about a brewery opening down the street from our home, but our visit tonight was close to terrible. With only 4 tables of guests, the service was shockingly slow. We were told multiple times the food would be out soon and after over a hour of waiting on a Thursday evening our food arrived. The owner shared he would discount the food while we were waiting. Of the three burgers we ordered (medium well, medium and medium rare) all were over cooked and burned. We hope this place can survive, but doubtful after leaving with full meals on the table. At least the beer selections were good.

OgoEnJoDJbLK2cLF687AWQ.text: Came here on a Friday night for a couple drinks. Service was great! The guys were really nice and even offered samples. The beers were $5.50 and I had wine for $7 but the pour was generous. The place wasn't empty but wasn't busy either. It was cute, I would definitely come back.

lXdE57XDbhI_H5TJEa5w4g.text: Disappointed after all the other reviews I had read. They now have barbecue and it is average. The burgers also were average. The fries are great. I wish that I found it equal to what others have said about the place.

70yqZW7rsFofwP4zMuSqkQ.text: Best beef brisket I have ever had.  Tender, great flavor. My husband had the grilled cchicken sandwich, which was also excellent. Friendly, attentive service. We are visiting from out of town, but if I'm ever back in Chandler, would put this place on the top of my list.

ecKxVf9P5My5k2vF2y7a4A.text: Amazing restaurant! The staff was friendly and the service was wonderful! Not to mention food that good is hard to find in Arizona! It will be a weekly stop.

JQ8nnTgN56XNsMBd-Xrxhw.text: Just left Twisted Cactus Brewing Company and not only did I love the Cowboy burger and their cheeseboard yummy!!! But far more from the food we had so much fun with Alex and our fellow bar mates...we laughed so much!!! OMG so much!!!  Arms down so fun!! You who were there will understand!!!

uxolhERFZZWW0u-F-xNbaw.text: Husband and I were in town and looking for a fun place to have a beer. This place was perfect! It is fairly new and don't have their own beers on tap, but that just makes us want to come back sooner. They have some great food options and Portland had some pictures of the food to show us, which was a great idea. It was a quiet time of day, but that made our first visit even better. Portland gave some great recommendations and even better conversation. This place is only going to get better and better in the future, a must visit!

N4kU17tzIZ5KozzV72Nflw.text: While they are presently still waiting for their license to serve their namesake beer, their food menu is great! I can't wait to try their beers when they are able to serve them. The local beers they keep on tap are still great choices. Keep up the good work!

AVrPrqhsjY19l7AiqPFCBw.text: Amazing burger with Poblano Chiles and the sides (fries and coleslaw) were delicious as well! Great selection of beers on tap and the service was excellent! We will be back for sure! Nice little hidden gem

_09GUAffMAZI6bbjhB_Faw.text: Nice local place with good beers on tap, excellent food and friendly service. Definitely recommend the Cuban.

QVrGA0GbjdpDJGzZ-Y8zWw.text: I just had the cowboy up burger & it was perhaps the best hamburger I've even had.  They said they use grass fed local beef which is a big plus for me also.  The combination of some think lightly fired onions, bbq sauce with lettuce/tomato on a fresh bun gave this great taste.  I'll definitely come back with my friends.  I also chose a side salad instead of fries.  It was large with fresh cucumbers, tomatoes & mixed fresh greens & as good as one would get in a fine restaurant.

oP9SRAeqcWE6kClU3ckPTQ.text: This is a wonderful lunch and dinner place!  The hamburgers are amazing and there's a good selection of craft beer.  Highly recommend!

8fNV-UjZusetZPunpDUCgQ.text: Excellent food, service and ambience!  Went in with grandparents, kids and grand kids.  Very enjoyable.  Would highly recommend, and we will be back.

SZvIOZ29jslPA9NTajGpqg.text: Haven't had a burger like this since I lived in NY. I had the cowboy burger. Every single bite was better than the last. Couldn't have left more satisfied. I actually left his joint with a smile on my face cause the burger was so damn delicious. God damn. This review looks fake actually but I swear to you it's not.

HtoT_Fwow7cd-8F-Ytbw1w.text: my new favorite  place  to go. great  beer!!!!   awesome  burgers.  the staff rocks. A gem in Chandler.

CL5lTiPhJT13PwnB8Kxnpg.text: Not a brewery as of this writing as they are waiting to get approvals to start brewing.  The food is really pretty good but a small menu. Salads and Burgers essentially. Pretty tasty sauces that you can order extra give the food an extra lift.  Pretty fair prices.  Place is on the small side with maybe 30 seats so not really good for large groups.

wJX14O9grTSknoinPWFCkQ.text: This place is great! Excellent food, wonderful service and their twisted cactus IPA was so good (and I don't generally like IPA's) I highly recommend stopping by. We will definitely be back!

zmWASRxIvGQcZ9O-me1wNQ.text: Stopped in for a beer to check out this new brewery. Very nice small space in a strip mall in Chandler with a couple of tvs, a bar, and 8 or 9 tables. Unfortunately, not able to serve their own beers yet, but soon. As is, they have a nice mix of local and out of state taps. Friendly staff. Bartender offered to let us taste a couple of selections before we chose what to order. Limited food selection. Mainly appetizers and sandwiches. We tried the Cuban sandwich, and it was great. Plentiful ingredients, and the Dijon mustard, rather than typical yellow, really topped it off well.  The side salad we got, rather than fries, was really generous. We don't live close, but will definitely be back next time we are in the area.

CjvlqSukyvC6g9iZxCimpw.text: My husband and I stopped by for an early lunch yesterday after the harvest festival. We were the only customers there, so we sat at the bar. The owner greeted us immediately and was very friendly. They have an unfiltered IPA right now that was amazing, even though I'm not usually and IPA person. I had the brisket sandwich and fries and my husband had the smoked pork. We both thought our food was delicious and the conversation was awesome!!

1rtiG6s_Lip8uO1MQOREkA.text: Hands down the Best Burger in the area. Owners are super friendly and will remember your face. Biggest downfall, which they are new so we hope this gets better, is the service- especially when it's busy-- once we waited over an hour and the waitress when asked still hadn't put in our appetizer order so we left. Although that was a little extreme, our other visits never took that long but also there wasn't as many customers. Still would def recommend during the slower times and the cactus burger is a must try!

lp7uTUAFcRjg_zCTquIOoA.text: I was pretty unimpressed with this place and vowed to not go back, but after they switched ownership, I decided to give it a try and I am glad we did. The ambience is so much better. With the original owners, it almost felt a little awkward and the servers were totally untrained. Under the new ownership, we felt welcome and there was music and sports on. The servers were very friendly and took good care of us and the food was great. Overall, I am glad I went back and will definitely try a few more times since it is so close to my house.

04DZBocCcxzDGmJ87I8kvg.text: Don't let the location (in a strip mall) fool you, this is a hidden gem! Get the Orange Bloosm beer - so refreshing! Burgers and fries are outstanding as well. The guys running it were so friendly too. Highly recommend!

3Kf2UeYN2--er1UCNsTP_g.text: Truffle fries, burger and brisket sandwich were all really good. We will be back to try more of the menu

qZzGz3sGJye9Ya2-WBWSQg.text: We had a taste for BBQ last Saturday and after seeing all the great reviews decided to try Twisted Cactus since it's so close to our house.  We were greeted quickly upon arrival and told we could sit anywhere we liked.  In just a few minutes the waiter brought menus and we ordered our drinks.  Food came up fairly quickly. My husband ordered the brisket, pork and potato salad with an extra side of Cole slaw.  I ordered brisket, ribs, fries and an extra side of Cole slaw.  The brisket was very tasty and served on Texas toast, but it was cold.  The pork was excellent and warm.  The ribs were outstanding and warm.  If the brisket would have been hot we would have given the meal five stars!  As for the sides, the fries were awesome, but the Cole slaw and potato salad weren't worth it - both were totally  tasteless.  Prices are reasonable.  Will we return?  Probably, when we want bbq and don't want to drive far.

fVSOb61ukaZsVYQSJHEq9g.text: Place had great burgers great beer great service fight was on football is on good time

Hm1OrDX9LrVY0Ul0-y09Tw.text: Great little local bar!  We were visiting from NC and went here based upon other reviews on Yelp. Smoked BBQ very good and appetizer tacos tasty!  Small section of draft beers, but a good mix. If we lived here, it would certainly be a place we would frequent.  Highly recommend.

v3_tzsMlB5EWdyjNr2464g.text: Great service, the pretzel bites were good and I enjoyed the IPA. The atmosphere was pleasant. We would definitely go back and try the other beers that were available.

WZVI4k4jiO94uh-vNzpvGg.text: Excellent food with a great presentation. If I were to nitpick I would like some bigger tvs and a drink list on the menu, but food and service are excellent and definitely exceeded expectations. Will absolutely be back!

n3QTfwNr0elVXR2zfX6tiQ.text: This review is based on two visits this past weekend during the daytime for lunch. They have one menu so no changes at night. I had read some prior reviews so I was wondering what I was walking in to but was pleasantly surprised.  Atmosphere - Good natural light during the day, the tables aren't crowded so it was comfortable. They had good music in the background but it was at the right level. They have a semi-open kitchen so you see the chef working hard to put out some really good food.  Service - It wasn't real busy and we had very attentive service. No issues.  Beer - They haven't started brewing there yet but have a good variety of 7 taps with some great local breweries like Huss Brewing.  Food - Everything, from both meals, was outstanding. Of the four dishes we had three different burgers and they were the best I've had in the area. The  1/2 lb patties have a good sear/char but cooked perfectly to my requested temperature (medium rare). All high quality ingredients from the meat, bun, bacon, etc. We had the Twisted Cactus burger with fresh poblanos roasted, the Cowboy Up which has a ton of flavor and the Bacon Blue which had awesome bacon. The French fries are handmade and awesome. I'll repeat, best burgers in the area, period.  I've read other reviews and heard the same things from friends so I hope management has worked out the service because the burgers are go to dishes.

KAnBFNWQlo849rqAwPcMyw.text: Great neighborhood place. Good food and service, delish beers and super good vibe. Go check it out small local and fun.

2KXUbZ2QnVsqK7jsT_Y9YA.text: Love this place. Amazing house IPA. Really, really nice people. Great burgers and homemade sauces.

jZSd3Ia6-p63s31ko7v-eQ.text: Friendly staff and some of the best burgers in town. Well worth a try and laid back atmosphere.

cOsAa_mzeEwcTusUV2GLYQ.text: Great burger & homemade fries and a a decent selection of good beers. Good service. I'll definitely stop in again next time I'm in town.

BBzwAv3WbHEYfGS2GRVXtA.text: We are always looking for a new place for our family to try. The service was great! The burgers are very tasty and the fries are awesome! We brought our young boys and they both ordered a kids meal. Both boys thought the sliders, chicken tenders and fries were delicious!

J1JULPF4BtVPUozzep1kHg.text: Super cute little place!!  We had an assortment of burgers, which were all delicious and well priced.  We also tried the brisket which was very flavorful.  The potato salad, though a small portion, had great flavor.  The only thing that could use a little work was the flavorless cole slaw.  We had 2 sides that we barely touched.  We look forward to trying other things on the menu!

_2RemZWMhdUG25p-J1tVFA.text: What a great little hidden gem. Comfortable atmosphere and local beers on tap. You can tell that the chef takes great pride in the food he's making for you. I highly recommend the poutine fries. The serving size is great to share with others and the flavors are amazing.

HKYo4G8QYMSwr1I5zgHQNA.text: Cozy small BBQ place.. I liked their brisket plate, and would like to try beef ribs as well whenever the add it to the menu

NSllL5opAoVp0AUR7N1Kkw.text: I came here looking for some bbq in my area and found much more! The food is awesome, from the ribs to the poutine and bbq fries! A great selection of local craft beers that are always changing. The owners are great and the staff and cook are very friendly. I think I'm becoming a regular lol. More people need to find this hidden gem.

fcr07Is9ZNRVUFzxFONhfw.text: I went in with low expectations as most BBQ places in town don't compare well to Rudy's (for price and quality) or Little Miss BBQ (probably some of the best BBQ in the country but pricey).  This place was a welcomed surprise.  I went with the Hog Boss Dog was was very satisfied.  It had a splendid amount of pulled pork, BBQ beans, onions and fresca queso draped over a very juicy and quite tasty smoked frank.  I paired it with a side of potato salad, which was good, but would probably go with slaw next time to really compliment the taste and texture of the dog.  The price was reasonable and I left with the expectation that I would be back again as the menu offerings seem extensive.  Keep up the fine work!

n737RGwkWX9thVsDYdvAeg.text: I would give this place a solid 3.75 stars. The service was really good for how busy it was on a weekday during lunch, food was pretty solid for it being a pub-n-grub type of place, and the beer selection was good. They have some good happy hour specials and lots of TV's for watching sports. I had the pulled pork burrito and it was CA style with fries, pork was tender, and salsa had a good bite to it. Definitely worth checking out.

obLpGuQQcig3fnnh3s4xMw.text: Quite possibly the tastiest, freshest, most affordable bbq I've ever had... and this is coming from a Missouri/Texas girl!   The flavor of the meat stood out 110% from other places I've tried. Its similar to Lucilles, which is another favorite of mine. BBQ sauce was tasty... not too sweet or spicy just perfect!   The menu is small so you dont have to worry about getting overwhelmed with choices. I had poutine fries for 6 bucks and it was so much food I couldnt eat it all!   Service was second to none... friendliest waitress I've ever had (visit 9/2 1140am)! Would come back based on service alone but the food is so good i will bring everyone back!   Super impressed. Chill vibe. Will be back. I dont think I've ever been so happy at a BBQ place... yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Poutine. So much food!!!

eHpqswlORgAwQoYhG19YDQ.text: I can't say enough greatness about this place! Amazing service, and a wonderful music selection.  Delicious drinks. Moscow mule was not too overpowering every flavor perfectly balanced. The on tap ipa was crisp and refreshing with sweet flavors. The lager was bright and smooth. We were lucky enough to be there Taco Tuesday the smoked pork tacos were full flavored and unaccompanied by a hot homemade salsa.  The brisket taco was also good, but definately the pork is best. The chicken taquitos were Uh-Maze-ing!! Smoked chicken and hand rolled. Crunchy, and moist;the ratio foe tortilla to filling was on point. The truffle fries were bold and salty with perfect notes of flavor nothing too overwhelming. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. Taco, taquitos, beans, and salsa Moscow mules

9FR2YfJpakNIqR2dNOTC-w.text: Beer- great selection.   Food- 50/50. The burger was good and the fries were fresh.  Were they made a grave error was the queso. We thought we would be getting some organic/farm to table...stuff but what we got was just nachos with stale chips like you get at a high school football game. UNACCEPTABLE!!!   Service - it was lunchtime and they only had 1 server. He was nice enough but we saw good waiting in the window a few times.   Overall a small place with a lot of potential. I will try it again but most likely only when I'm thirsty.

dE_HlLiZ0pRZTNxDUmKT3g.text: Great BBQ spot! I also love the beer list! Lots of great local choices. I love supporting local, especially when they support local! The food, beer, service, and atmosphere are spot on!

gwUxPXaYBUUh9q4YjUUw3w.text: Great Ribs and Burgers Friendly Service!   My whole group was pleased!  We will be back!

P5yUVcdRmjC-OL9eQzEYeg.text: Unbelievably flavored, fall off the bone, smoked pork ribs to die for!!  Can't believe we didn't find this place sooner.  Had garlic truffle fries (awesome), rich potato salad, and a remarkable sweet vinegar coleslaw that surprised & delighted.  Topped it all off with a nutty brown craft beer that will definitely bring me back.

TnoQzKcpsG-HUuhF47NEsQ.text: Stopped into Twisted Cactus this afternoon. The ribs are awesome. They are thick, smokey, and juicy. Loads of meat on the rib!  The bbq sauce is flavorful and a little spicy. The sides are generous portions, too. The slaw is traditional and creamy. The beans have loads of sauce and quite a bit of meat, too. The quesadilla is not one folded tortilla, but two making a cheesey, spicy sandwich. The accompanying salsa is chock full of flavor and brings a good bit of heat with it!  The staff is friendly and solicitous, but not bothersome. This is a place to be one of the neighborhood favorites!

DLrLR9SYyFyr8P7CP5QDJw.text: I came in and was immediately greeted and told to sit where I like. I chose the bar because I was alone. Then a nice woman came by and offered me a free sample of beer.  I ordered the blueberry sour and brisket soft tacos. It was delicious and exactly the right amount of food I needed.  I also loved the atmosphere. The bartender was friendly, the music was nice and not too loud, and the service was very attentive. Will definitely go back and take friends.

7lWZrLBLF_SGW9nQ3SlqlA.text: Great food, music and friendly service as always. Neighborly atmosphere. Lively but not too loud. Taco Tuesday's are worth a walk over to enjoy tacos and a beer.

YA1f8cdKQXu4ysYncBuXYw.text: Just stumbled upon this little diamond of hangout. Great ambiance with a nice little bar, couple large TV's and an awesome assortment of cocktails and local craft brews. Pretty sweet art created by local artists line the walls. Brought some work associates and really enjoyed wrapping up our afternoon here. Try anything on the menu...its money!

6mJcEsSr9w1aTwnQHBeOTA.text: The truffle fries are very good. We also ordered the brisket and pork. I preferred the brisket but the pork was good too. I received only a small amount of the "vegetable of the day" as my side. The small bowl was less than half way filled, it was sad looking but tasted ok. Portion sizes could use some adjustments. Good and timely service.

CHWbWOKcwYO4AkQgftGkXA.text: I came here on my birthday, 1/6/19 and not only was the food absolutely delicious, but so was the service!!! We ordered the 1/2 rack St.Louis ribs, fries and bbq beans. For our appetizer, we had the nachos and paired it with the house margarita. We left very satisfied and stuffed!!!! We will definitely return and spread the word.

w4L312_gVYF8KprrgOpm_w.text: Great hole in the wall neighborhood restaurant! Burgers and BBQ with beer and fun cocktails. TVs all all around with hockey, basketball and football. Great vibe and good food. BBQ ribs were tender and delicious, my son loved the the kids pork sliders and my Cactus burger was a tasty treat.

UcMx_hrimb-vXqsGr1W2Gg.text: Needed a burger tonight. Ordered up the cheese fries first, decent for an appetizer. They serve hand cut fries which is always awesome. Only thing with the fries they could use a tiny bit more cheese, that's just me being picky though. Ordered up the twisted cactus burger. Angus beef, poblano chilis, chipotle aioli what else can you ask for? This burger is good and delicious. As for the Staff they were excellent and greeted my family as soon as we got in the door! Will totally be back to try that bbq next!

oFXW_I4TQcN6QkG96CBa-Q.text: What's not to like? It's delicious, affordable, veggie friendly, dog friendly, homemade fries, delicious green and red salsas, lots of beers and special margaritas, taco Tuesday brisket tacos are the bomb. New business. Bring them some love!

0yrSgbVthq080ttqtLZJzg.text: Had 4 adults for lunch. Found on Yelp. BBQ w/sides, small but GREAT BBQ with excellent personal service W/beer & wine!!!! Will be back!

lJ8rsGXzZnDt0gcq_T4Mcw.text: The place seemed cool and looked slow so we dropped it. It was a very long wait for the food and it was okay. Not at all what I was expecting. And forget about the tap water. One sip and it went to the side. We both had burgers. At least the fries were good.

Pv2FeyFKq7K12PdUDcwQXA.text: We got there towards the end of the night.  Good beer choices and for what we had (Bomb Burrito and Blue Cheese Burger) was tasty.  The server was nice and we didn't have to ask for refills.  Would go back and try something else on the menu.

9YHrsIhd5wftv8Z1cHIotA.text: We stopped in and tried this place out last weekend. It was our first time. Under new ownership and they really seem to be hands on. Food was fantastic and they have a good amount of drafts to choose from. Will definitely be back.

ODuym6DFv4MSMhnq0u6pew.text: Their burgers are excellent! Like one of the best burgers I've ever had. I would highly recommend this place. Their tacos weren't good but everything else was delicious.

2a0hM_A00Z6OkcNAa4QAGA.text: Was excited to check this place out. Hours posted stated open until 10pm. Showed up about 8.15pm and they had already closed.  Why even post hours if you don't adhere to them.

CPW6h5Bm9E8SvGW_6CkD1A.text: Awesome place, they have amazing brisket and some tasty ice cold beers made in Arizona

kuVGRc8TuzH7zAJIyBRaLA.text: This restaurant/sports bar had no shortcomings. The service was above and beyond, the atmosphere was nice, music was good, and the food was absolutely delicious. I saw an old picture of a burger that they no longer had on the menu, and the cook shouted out "I can make that!" when I was asking the waiter about it. It was very tasty. It's tucked away in the corner so it's hard to spot, but definitely worth giving it a try! I will definitely be back soon.

TqhGToinf2BiEukV1KDYNw.text: The guys here are very nice.  The environment is nice for a laid back date night. My husband and I try to visit new places and this one we will defintely be back to visit.  Burgers were fulfilling and beer waa awesome!

Z9qana2fJMpLGtSGdCl7Lg.text: The absolute best ribs we have ever had. We were a group of ten and everyone loved their meal. The beer selection and service were also all top notch. Give this place a try you will not regret it!!

4_RxksXaCXchs769wDGvfA.text: I'll start with the good: our server was great! She was super attentive and accommodating.  And now the not so good: Food was "ok." I had the cowboy burger and fries, my wife had the twisted cactus with slaw. My burger was very good, but the fries were limp. My wife's burger was "bland" (her words) and the slaw was fresh but "not that flavorful."  At the time of this review, the brewery was not brewing any beer and was instead serving local craft beer, which was disappointing. That being said, the locals they had were good.  Overall: I'll be back if it's someone else's idea. Too many excellent brewery's out there with top notch food and beer for me to spend my limited out to eat budget on "ok" food and another gamble on beer their house brews.

OCzuKswDRaSJDDW7tuY_0g.text: This place is the PEAK of customer service. We were looking for a new brewery to dive into and we found a hidden gem. Delicious food, amazing beer and fare prices. The chef though is something to rave about. I came here with my 78 year old grandfather. He's senile and we love him. We ordered the poutine so it would be soft for him too chew and he complained about the lack of pulled pork. This chef hand delivered us more pulled pork on him. I was so happy and papa was a little embarrassed but they also gave us 2 glasses to take home. 10/10 I would recommend again.

8jYUxt53jey7e-PDe791hQ.text: Great burgers and beer.... tasted the Papago Orange Blossom and our whole group was hooked!

fEnw_k5dJPAWNYbGPE8fgA.text: Stopped in for a late lunch on a Saturday and had the bacon bleu burger. It was super delicious - better than I expected - beef was amazing. Staff was friendly and helpful and very accommodating. Would definitely go back.

I4h4VgJ57cUpV52c3z1haQ.text: Under new ownership! Everyone is so nice! Great food, great service! Cowboy burger, ribs, poutine fries and fried icecream are all delicious! Highly recommend.

MN_kxSYcvg3G97R2-Luvag.text: Very comfortable/cool AZ setting. Their house IPA is very good, and the Stockyards hamburgers are great. We love the trio of dipping sauces and their homemade fries. Tasty, casual, cool with good music and nice neighborhood bar scene.

aQ7YmvQLE71O2ytUsbzxVA.text: This place needs management help. Walked in and told to sit anywhere. Took a while for a server to even come over to take drink order and give us menus. Even though one "server" was chatting it up with another table. The menu looked decent but the long wait for a beer, the mild odor and poor atmosphere turned us off. The table next to us asked the server about the tuna sliders. His response? "I don't know. No one ever buys them. I haven't even seen them."  After that, we bailed out. I hope the owners take control of this place in a hurry or they will go broke fast.

RCUL4sxqtGuA6Sow05pUvg.text: Good choices of beer particularly IPA's... rotating taps ...friendly... great smoked brisket sandwich

fbK6cUcwyFWM64g6PYdf9w.text: Just in town for the weekend. Stopped in for a quick one and a snack. Had two beers and the poutine. House IPA

YL06_uHv7lliDNdYjxjU4Q.text: We don't live near by (we live in central Phoenix), but were in this area and love to try out new breweries.They did not have their own beers yet, but had a good selection of guest beers. ( I am guessing they have their own beers by now). We chatted the whole time with the very friendly bartender and even the cook stuck his head out to see if we liked his Cubano (very good!). We thought this place was fun, friendly and had a really good vibe. Check it out!

qRZreR7D5BEO-s2P571GbA.text: This place is GREAT.  We'd been there once just for drinks, and we liked it then.  We finally made it back to try the food, and our impression is even more positive now!  They have the kind of menu that makes you want to try everything in it.  And it's not too long, the way some restaurants try to serve a little of everything.  Just one page, which is plenty.  I had the St. Louis ribs and they were delicious.  They're saucy, super tender, and the perfect size.  If you're not into saucy bbq, there are other great options, like the burgers, the wings, the brisket, a Sonoran hot dog (which I'm determined to try in the future), and others.  The fries are also delicious, both the regular (hand-cut) type, and the ones with garlic parmesan.  Their drink selection is strong!  Bottled beers, craft beers on tap, and some really good, semi-obscure whiskeys and tequilas, as well as margaritas and other cocktails.  They have a nice bar area, as well as tables (quasi-booths).  I am also a fan of the place itself.  It's small, but they very smartly maximize their space.  There's the bar, then there's like a small counter area, and then there are tables.  The kitchen is semi-open, so you can see it from the bar.  Even though it's a small place, I reckon they can easily fit 30 people COMFORTABLY in there.  I hesitate to use this word, but I kept thinking how the whole experience for us was flawless.  We will definitely be back.

4Rkdkmjb6wN9gwK7WP2PaQ.text: We've visited this place twice now and both visits were great. Customer service is excellent and accommodating overall.   They typically have a few local craft beers that are tasty as well, which is nice when paired with their bbq.   We've had the pulled pork and the brisket and both were awesome. I could use a bit larger portion though. Overall the food is consistently good and I'd recommend.

UWvwfUenhjjdFTT7OoRZeA.text: Hankering for bbq found this place. This place is in a strip mall like many places in the valley.    We stopped off around 1. It was quiet  Ordered the brisket sandwich lunch special with fries. My friend had the 3 meat combo The brisket was good lots of fries enough for sharing. The pork and brisket on the 3 meat combo were excellent. The ribs however I'm sad to say were actually overdone. Not falling off the bones, not burnt ends just hard and dry. Maybe they had an off day.   The menu has some interesting combos like bbq nachos, burritos. Kind of a play on Tex mex with bbq.  Only 1 selection of bbq sauce but it is good.   They have local beers and wines. Liquor for other drinks.   Service was friendly and prompt. Food came out fast at the right temp  They have $6 lunch specials and happy hour deals.   We enjoyed our lunch and would consider coming back if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. 3 meat combo, ribs, pork and brisket

9TiT5ukLL9fyPXmIxcktlA.text: Great barbecue and really good beer!  Service was great as well!  Glad we found this place!

Photo of Twisted Cactus Brew & BBQ - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Grand Canyon Burger

s43RgkQ9-7nS7-jV-wQ0KA.text: Delicious food and great service. The chips and salsa are my favorite, very spicy but great flavors.

MDqL2vs6ZSpcFe_53jrCCg.text: First time here and was impressed the moment I walked in. Music was awesome! Our server, Page, was patient with us and explained all the craft beers on tap. Not disappointed in the beers. Told us about the food, chose a pulled pork on brioche with fries. Wow! Very tasty and very fairly priced. Enough to bring home for another meal. I will be back!

NVeZ4mulzy8sGpe_vU7xow.text: Stopped in for a meal on a Thursday & we were not disappointed.  We started with the poutine fries - which normally I'm not a fan of (too messy).  These were great (fries with brown gravy, smoked pork & queso fresco) perfect balance of all flavors.  I loved that the gravy portion was enough to flavor & not saturate the fries.  We would order these again - definitely big enough to share.   Paired this with an Orange Blossom wheat beer from Papago Brewery - paired nicely.  When we were placing our dinner order, they informed us that the ribs had about 45 minutes left in the smoker.  We were not in a hurry, nor were we starving so we said we could wait.  The fries were enough to keep us satiated during that time.  Dinner did not disappoint.  The slab of ribs were extremely meaty & a very generous portion.  They did taste better the next day & we figured that perhaps the meat needed a little time to set up after coming out of the smoker.   The sauce was very good.   The other dinner we chose was the #3 combo of smoked pork and beef brisket with cole slaw.  They were both delicious  - meats were tender & very     I would order those again.

UWSe3pJIRdztXlJjcoasLw.text: Stopped in to try something new, I'll definitely be back! The beer selection is nice, the food was tasty and the server was attentive even with her being the only one here.

Af_kiMj-IzwJaZDl6lQvPQ.text: Great music! Yummy ribs and burgers, good size portions! Friendly service and AZ hometown beers are super!

ijdrjxkw1P8M8ZCjvMJ5aQ.text: Based on the reviews, I came here to try the BBQ ( I love good bbq)  and was disappointed. I ordered the ribs and they were dry; not fall off the bone. The sauce was a standard sweet spicy bbq sauce. Meat had flavor. I gave it another try and this time ordered the bbq lunch sandwich for take out, and again disappointed. The bun looked like, and tasted like, a store bought, pre packaged, small hamburger bun. They did fill it with a good portion of meat, but it was again dry. But this time, some bites had a burnt flavor. It was also chewy for a bbq sandwich and way too much sauce. I only ate half the small bbq sandwich. The portion of fries was considerably larger than the bbq  sandwich. So my main lunch entree was the fries. I didn't bother calling to complain because they would offer to make me another. I already had two bad bbq experiences, I don't need a third. Live and learn. I won't be returning for bbq. Staff and service was great. I realize this is a pub and not a bbq restaurant, so the three stars is for the pub, drinks, service and staff. Food, minus two.

lHIBSLiQuxJUUiKIr8C0iQ.text: This is the best BBQ I've had since moving to Arizona. It has such a cool atmosphere and the staff is super friendly. I try to make it a habit to go here once a week now. The BBQ Beef sliders are definitely my go to- they have a great Smokey taste and aren't overloaded with BBQ sauce. 10/10 recommend

35EH4sDH7GXdlZ-9IuD0XA.text: This is a great place for a drink and dinner. Our service was fantastic and the atmosphere was perfect. Multiple TVs to watch and a bar to grab your favorite brew. We had a couple of burgers and bbq beans and potato salad; all of which was great. Samantha (server) was engaging and had really good recommendations. I highly recommend this place for date night or out with friends!

QkPX7dZmMoM8OZioROTKvQ.text: I ordered the BBQ Chicken Nachos and a Brisket taco.  Both were delicious and fantastic.   The nachos was just the right balance of Smokey BBQ and spicy Mexican flavor.   Really good.

IN78qxeLSdFryAAGrwrLEQ.text: Strong burgers, fresh-cut fries, good service, interesting menu that gives you reasons to come back.  Also like the focus on local brews and wines.  Cool place.  Will be back.

HWEX8cJwEhmfFi6FwrvJWw.text: Brisket was good. Only comes with one side which was plenty but at most BBQ places for the price would expect two. Decent beer selection for a Sunday afternoon. If it were in our neighborhood we'd probably go back.

a3tZARZMAiNSh_hxgaZs6w.text: Really good bbq in North Chandler area. Ribs were savory and fell off the bone! Good bbq sauce and tasty St. Louis style dry rub.  Small place but very friendly and accommodating.   Will def come back here, even though I rarely go to Chandler for lunch or dinner!!
